snippet: The Fed and Supreme Court cultivate images of technocratic remove, but the ideology of their leaders still matters enormously. And Republicans have led both for more than 25 years.
abstract: David Leonhardt Capital Ideas column notes that Pres Obama seems poised to nominate a Democrat as the new Federal Reserve chairman, position that has been held by a Republican for more than a quarter century; examines the extent ideology affects the decisions of both Fed chairman and Supreme Court chief justice, which has also been occupied by a Republican for a similar length of time.
lead_paragraph: The Fed and Supreme Court cultivate images of technocratic remove, but the ideology of their leaders still matters enormously. And Republicans have led both for more than 25 years.

headline.main: A Rarity: A Democrat to Lead the Fed
headline.print_headline: A Rarity: A Democrat to Lead the Fed
